AE.NN.Network.Visu2d#

class AE.NN.Network.Visu2d(Net, isolate_output=True, dt=None, disp_time=False, size=None)#

Bases: Animation2d

2D network visualisation and animation tool

Generates a 2D representation of a network. As it derives from AE.Display.Animation.Animation2d, it can also be used to implement animations, like color-changing nodes to represent their values through time.

__init__(Net, isolate_output=True, dt=None, disp_time=False, size=None)#

Network 2D visualization constructor

Each node and link is converted to an AE.Display.Animation.element.

It also defines all the necessary attributes for animations.

Parameters:

  • Net (Network) – Network to visualize.

  • dt (float) – Animation time increment (s) between two updates.

  • disp_time (bool) – If true, the animation time is overlaid to the animation.

  • window (Window) – If not None, a simple window containing the visualization.

Methods

blockSignals(self, bool) → bool#
change(type, item)#

Drag callback

Reimplements AE.Display.Animation.Animation2d.change().

Parameters:

  • type (str) – type of change (move).

  • elm (AE.Display.Animation.element) – Element that has changed.

pyqtConfigure(...)#

Each keyword argument is either the name of a Qt property or a Qt signal. For properties the property is set to the given value which should be of an appropriate type. For signals the signal is connected to the given value which should be a callable.

show()#

Display animation window

If the animation’s parent is a Window object, the Window.show() method is called. Otherwise nothing is done.

signalsBlocked(self) → bool#

stop()#

f Stop the animation

Stops the timer and close the window, if any.

thread(self) → QThread#
timerEvent(self, QTimerEvent)#
tr(self, str, disambiguation: str = None, n: int = - 1) → str#
update()#

Update animation state

Update the animation time Animation.t. Subclass this method to implement the animation, e.g. moving elements or changing color.
